meanings.definition: The act of piercing or entering something
meanings.sent1: The penetrations of the needle into the fabric were precise.
meanings.sent2: The burglars made multiple penetrations into the house through the windows.
meanings.sent3: The cake was so delicious that it invited penetrations from all the party guests.
meanings.sent4: Her words made deep penetrations into his heart, leaving a lasting impact.
meanings.sent5: The penetrations of the roots into the soil were visible after the storm.

meanings.definition: The extent to which something has been pierced or entered
meanings.sent1: The penetrations on the metal surface were numerous.
meanings.sent2: The penetrations of the arrows into the target were impressive.
meanings.sent3: The penetrations of the mosquitoes into the room were annoying.
meanings.sent4: The penetrations of light through the clouds created a beautiful scene.
meanings.sent5: The penetrations of the vines into the fence showed nature's strength.

meanings.definition: The act of understanding or grasping something deeply
meanings.sent1: His penetrations into the complex theory were commendable.
meanings.sent2: The student's penetrations into the historical events were insightful.
meanings.sent3: The detective's penetrations into the case led to a surprising revelation.
meanings.sent4: Her penetrations into the character's emotions made her a great actress.
meanings.sent5: The scientist's penetrations into the data uncovered a groundbreaking discovery.
